data.title: NIH OAR Data Hub: NIH HIV Awards by All Data Elements
data.meta_description: .callout { background: gainsboro; float: right; width: 30%; padding: 1em; margin-left: 0.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; } Need help? Click here for video tutorials, definitions, and other resources to help navigate the Data Hub. Email OARinfo@nih.gov with any feedback.
data.text:
The NIH OAR Data Hub leverages and synthesizes publicly available data about the NIH HIV research portfolio to promote greater understanding of this research and to enable researchers to identify awards relevant to their specific interests.

The dashboard below combines the information from all other dashboards to allow for the deepest exploration of NIH HIV award funding. Use the dashboard below to explore recent NIH HIV awards by HIV research priority, HIV research objective, administrative Institute, Center, or Office (ICO), funding ICO, activity, mechanism, organization, investigator, project classification, NIH spending category, notice of funding opportunity (NOFO), and notice of special interest (NOSI).

Caption: The dashboard “NIH HIV Awards by All Data Elements” displays the HIV research portfolio. The dashboard displays the number of awards for each HIV research priority, for each HIV research objective, for each administrative Institute, Center, or Office (admin ICO), for each funding Institute, Center, or Office (funding ICO), for each activity, for each mechanism, for each organization, for each investigator, for each project classification, for each NIH spending category, for each notice of funding opportunity (NOFO), and for each notice of special interest (NOSI). The view can be filtered by fiscal year, research priority, research objective, admin ICO, funding ICO, activity, mechanism, organization, investigator, project classification, NIH spending category, NOFO, and NOSI. The user can conduct a text search for project titles, NOFO titles, and NOSI titles. There is one filter applied by default, to display the one most recent fiscal year of data.
